page.title: 01CHARNWOOD FOREST
page.content: Our D-block covers part of Charnwood Forest,an ancient forest that links us with 1068.Although much of the land has now been given over to mixed farming,a considerable amount of deci_ duous woodland remains.Tree-clad hills outcrops of Ancient Charnian rock,a small reservoir and proximity to Loughborough,makes the area attractive for leisure activities echoing again the land usage of the Domesday deer park.In the N.E. of the block,the out_ skirts of L'boro are linked by foot_ path and road to recreational centres as well as being only 3km from the M1 which traverses the area from north to south.The only Public House is at Nanpantan,a small settlement built at the head of an old short lived canal. In the N.W. Associated Road Stone Co. have large quarries supplying British Rail with mixed hard stone.
